item.title: Senior Manager, Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?
As a Senior Manager Analytics, you will work closing LOB Product managers and Insight & Client Engagement, Sales teams and Senior Management to achieve RBC’s strategic priorities.  Together with internal business partners, you will strive towards always earning the right to be the Canadian personal and business clients’ first choice by delivering an integrated, tailored, and superior client experience, growing profitable relationships with our clients, and creating sustainable value for RBC shareholders.  Supports information-based business decisions by identifying, understanding, capturing, organizing, presenting, and disseminating data.  You will be responsible for enabling discovery and implementation of key business opportunities and delivering capabilities with aggressive targets.  You will also support the achievement of business objectives by providing revenue generating capabilities or cost efficiencies through improved processes.

What will you do?

  • Key contributor on cross functional RBC client, product & channel strategy teams; develop hypotheses to assist in business decision-making through advanced in depth analytics in support of RBC strategic priorities.

  • Lead in the design, evaluation and quantification of these business strategies. Participate in strategy meetings to gather and document business requirements and learn how to formulate analytical framework.  Provide recommendation for analysis.

  • Perform all manner of data mining activities towards channel, product and client-centric applications (activities include, but are not limited to: data analysis, aggregation, and management).  Profile clients and channels.

  • Through analysis, contribute to the assessment of the business impact of business strategy initiatives.

  • Help internal business partners become self-sufficient in using business applications and reports.

  • Manage daily workflow, resolve conflicting priorities, and negotiate realistic timelines requiring minimum supervision.

  • Contribute actively in self and peer development relating to lines of businesses, products, channels, operational processes, relationship management, and technology enhancement.  Develop and share knowledge of new businesses, techniques, and ideas. 

  • Contribute to the overall effectiveness of the Information Delivery & Solutions team. 

  • Ensure compliance and privacy guidelines are strictly adhered to.

  • Champion a positive, trusting, and satisfying work climate by living RBC values and culture.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

  • 3+ years\' experience in related digital product development, marketing analyst or data mining role

  • Proven analytics and problem-solving skills

  • Strong drive and desire to understand relationship of organizational components

  • BA/BSc or above in mathematics, economics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative field

  • Advanced experience with SQL, Python, Scala, SAS or Tableau

  • Sound business acumen and strong analytical, communication and presentation skills

  • Strong problem solving skills and ability to conceptualize strategy

  • Demonstrated ability to work well collaboratively in a cross function environment as well as independently with initiative taking ownership

  • Demonstrated leadership in cross-functional environment.

  • Preference given to experience with multiple products and lines of businesses.

  • Invigorated when working under pressure.

  • Display fine balance of creativity, adaptability, motivation, and independence.

Nice-to-have:

  • Minimum successfully-completed undergraduate degree in Statistics, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, or a discipline that develops capability in data and analysis

  • Experience in financial services industry with broad understanding of marketing, product management, sales, finance, pricing and risk management

  • Experience with text analytics and statistical model development

  • Experience with Hadoop and Google Analytics

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Personal and Commercial Banking

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2023-03-22

Application Deadline:

2023-04-06

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

item.title: Data Analytics Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Data Analytics Analyst

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

Assist Internal Audit RBC US teams in the research, development, and delivery of strategic and analytics initiatives to achieve Audit objectives in alignment with Internal Audit’s transformation goals.  These initiatives affect operations and audit execution across multiple geographies and/or across multiple business units/platforms.  Responsible for supporting the performance and quality of analytics that will provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned for the respective platforms.

Support the business phases of the analytics lifecycle for the respective Internal Audit platform(s).  Responsible for assisting in internal and external research, stakeholder management, collaborative requirement gathering, and a user-centric approach that in combination ensure technical solutions are both valuable and readily adopted across Internal Audit.  Effectively collaborate closely with technical talent pools who transform proposed business cases into leading edge technological solutions.  Strategically recommend and apply existing technology to reduce duplication of efforts and ensure the Internal Audit platforms have the skills and capacity to use and understand the technology available across Internal Audit. Responsible for researching and developing foundational analytics that support Internal Audit RBC US teams.

What will you do?

Analytics Lab Support

  • Assist in the creation and maintenance of foundational data & analytics initiatives that provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned in the platform(s).
  • Support effective delivery of a pipeline of data analytics and automation initiatives that impact Audit execution activities globally across all regions and lines of business.
  • Acts as a peer to the Data Engineers and Data Scientists in the centralized Data Management & Analytics team (DMA).
  • Empowered to challenge and refine the value of analytics ideas as proposed by the auditors.

Business Case Development and Adoption Support

  • Conduct research and identify opportunities for improving processes and technology: Externally, research best practices, emerging risks, and innovation across RBC and broadly throughout the financial sector. Internally, gather, understand, and analyse auditors’ pain points.
  • Size potential upside of deploying a solution across platforms, in line with your findings. In partnership with technical experts and other stakeholders, define and articulate ROI for your business cases for Executive Selection Committee approval.
  • Support technical builds and process reengineering aligned with business cases at every step of analytics lifecycle; engage auditors as needed and support user acceptance testing across your platforms.
  • Support the communication of ongoing work to broad Internal Audit audience and support creation of training materials and experiences for selected tools.

Technological use and Reuse

  • Support the adoption of centrally developed data products in the platform with support from the DMA team.
  • Support global adoption of IA wide data initiatives.
  • Support technology use and reuse by having a thorough understanding of available and upcoming technology across the Internal Audit toolkit.
  • Assist in review of quarterly Audit plan for existing tool use to reduce duplication of efforts and to ensure technology provides expected return.
  • Support gathering and triage feedback for technical experts on an ongoing basis.

Leadership & People Development

  • Mentor team members - assist with individual capability building and certification, grow the skillsets /capabilities of the team, transfer skills/knowledge, and demonstrate awareness of linkages and political forces.
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with team members, process stakeholders, support groups, business partner teams, to ensure collaboration and cooperation to meet timing of projects.
  • Continually demonstrate commitment to and application of RBC Leadership Model Behaviors.

What do you need to succeed?

Overall

  • Good understanding of programming languages (Python, SQL, R)
  • Strong understanding and experience using data visualization tools
  • Strong understanding of Data Analytics to optimize use
  • Knowledge of financial industry regulatory guidelines
  • Knowledge of auditing principles and techniques
  • Proficient written and oral communication skills
  • Proficient in project management
  • Ability to learn new and emerging technologies
  • Ability to work in a dynamically changing environment.

Technical experience:

  • Proven ability to produce, conduct, and report on internal and external research, including qualitative and quantitative metrics
  • Demonstrated ability to calculate ROI for projects of various complexity and scale
  • Working knowledge of Python, SQL, Data Visualization, UX/UI
  • Working knowledge of Agile or other lean methodologies
  • Working knowledge of design, development, and implementation experience utilizing data technologies
  • Proficient analytical and problem solving skills
  • Proficient data profiling, cleaning, and mining
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders
  • Proficient data extract, transform, and load processes with a variety of data types
  • Experience with big data technologies – Hadoop (Pig, Hive), noSQL/SQL databases, parallel processing techniques and Apache Spark

Leadership and People Management experience:

  • Demonstrates they have successfully worked in inclusive and diverse work teams
  • Proven ability to multitask and prioritize activities; across borders and cultures
  • Experience working as a team member on a special project, over an extended period of time

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

The good-faith expected salary range for the above position is $65,000 - $105,000 depending on factors including but not limited to the candidate’s experience, skills, registration status; market conditions; and business needs.  This salary range does not include other elements of total compensation, including a discretionary bonus and benefits such as a 401(k) program with company-matching contributions; health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance; and paid time-off plan.

RBC’s compensation philosophy and principles recognize the importance of a highly qualified global workforce and plays a critical role in attracting, engaging and retaining talent that:

·       Drives RBC’s high performance culture

·       Enables collective achievement of our strategic goals

·       Generates sustainable shareholder returns and above market shareholder value

USAUDIT23

Job Summary

Assist Internal Audit RBC US teams in the research, development, and delivery of strategic and analytics initiatives to achieve Audit objectives in alignment with Internal Audit’s transformation goals. These initiatives affect operations and audit execution across multiple geographies and/or across multiple business units/platforms. Responsible for supporting the performance and quality of analytics that will provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned for the respective platforms.

Support the business phases of the analytics lifecycle for the respective Internal Audit platform(s). Responsible for assisting in internal and external research, stakeholder management, collaborative requirement gathering, and a user-centric approach that in combination ensure technical solutions are both valuable and readily adopted across Internal Audit. Effectively collaborate closely with technical talent pools who transform proposed business cases into leading edge technological solutions. Strategically recommend and apply existing technology to reduce duplication of efforts and ensure the Internal Audit platforms have the skills and capacity to use and understand the technology available across Internal Audit. Responsible for researching and developing foundational analytics that support Internal Audit RBC US teams.

Address:

Jersey City, New Jersey, United States of America

City:

USA-NJ-JERSEY CITY

Country:

United States of America

Work hours/week:

40

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Internal Audit

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2023-01-12-08:00

Application Deadline:

2023-03-07-08:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

item.title: Manager, Fraud Detection Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Fraud Detection Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a Manager, Fraud Detection Analytics, you will be responsible for the development and execution of fraud detection strategies using advanced analytical methodologies and techniques. These fraud detection strategies will be applied with the goal of reducing RBC’s Fraud Risk and losses, while maintaining a positive client experience and controlling operating costs. You will innovate and implement novel methodologies to improve detection and efficiency across the team, further automating and streamlining processes.  You will contribute to and support a variety of projects and initiatives across Fraud Management and collaborate with multiple stakeholders at varying levels of seniority.

Please Note: This position is not a people manager role and we welcome applicants from across Canada.

What will you do?

  • Implement advanced analytical methodologies and proactively identify opportunities to innovate new techniques for fraud detection strategy creation and process and technology improvements
  • Collaborate with Data Science & Innovation on machine learning and artificial intelligence projects that impact fraud detection, document methodology and standardize process to ensure repeatability
  • Develop, maintain and optimize fraud detection strategies for non-traditional channels & products, and explore multiple data sources to proactively identify emerging fraud trends and patterns
  • Leverage reporting to monitor the performance of existing fraud detection strategies, optimize these strategies and use analytical tools to improve detection strategies, enhancing the tools & techniques
  • Prioritize fraud detection alerts across detection platforms, verify that all rule deployments are accurate and ensure a balance between fraud losses, client experience and operational costs
  • Contribute to Fraud Management projects and initiatives, provide detection recommendations and  implement detection strategies by project deadlines
  • Develop Fraud Detection analytics best practices, contribute to the development and implementation of the rule strategy framework and create programming code standards for fraud detection
  • Collaborate across the team to ensure best practices are applied, act as a technical resource for other team members and respond to inquiries regarding fraud data and detection strategies

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 3+ years’ experience in analytics or data science related roles, working with large, real-world datasets
  • Strong practical knowledge of, and proven experience with, analytical software packages and various programming languages (eg: SAS, R, SQL, Python etc.)
  • Strong critical thinking and analytical skills with the ability to solve complex problems and develop data-driven solutions
  • Exceptional communication and presentation skills, including the ability to effectively communicate analytical recommendations to technical and non-technical audiences
  • Thought leadership capability to lead complex initiatives and discussions driven by analytical and business insights
  • Ability to see the big picture and guide groups with strategic thinking
  • Excellent time management skills and demonstrated ability to prioritize workload effectively
  • Degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative discipline

Nice-to-have

  • Experience with Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Scala or other big-data platform technology/tools
  • Knowledge of Canadian banking and payment industry payments transaction data and financial fraud 

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Continued career advancement opportunities
  • Exposure to strong mentorship and leadership examples
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact 
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, and high-performing team

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-AB-CALGARY, CAN-BC-VANCOUVER, CAN-NS-BEDFORD, CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

37.5

Full time

Personal and Commercial Banking

item.title: Manager, Risk Analytics – Counterparty Credit Risk Innovative Analytics ( 6 Months Contract)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Risk Analytics – Counterparty Credit Risk Innovative Analytics ( 6 Months Contract)

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

Our team is focused on the design and deployment of capabilities that enable the end-to-end transformation of our Capital Markets’ Counterparty Credit Risk reporting and analytic metrics, building and leading with technologies that put advanced analytic and AI practices at the forefront.

We are a team of 30+ resilient, collaborative people with strong backgrounds in both risk management and data analytic, delivering trusted data and analytic capabilities to support top of the house Counterparty Credit Risk Analytic function for RBC Capital markets operations.

Our main goal is building a future-proof tech stack with modern, flexible architecture that is reusable across different internal channels. In this role, you will join a newly formed Advanced Analytic Team that embraces innovation and is excited to bring a fresh perspective into the design, enhancement and deployment of a state of the art risk analytic platform.

What will you do?

As the Manager in Innovative Analytics Team, you will play a key role in contributing to continuous research, design and delivery of an advanced multi-disciplined risk analytic platform within the RBC Capital Markets Counterparty Credit Risk Management Team.

Nurturing culture and facilitating learning and knowledge sharing will be second nature to you as well as applying your technical know-how to ensure that the Innovative Analytic team is on the leading edge of technical delivery practices. You’ll have the tools and support needed to achieve extraordinary results that make a significant impact extending beyond the boundaries of traditional technology roles. Ideas start here – and you will build great technology.

If you’re a hands-on technical expert with proven experience operating within high-performing teams, are continuously learning, and excited to collaborate with those around you—we have a spot for you on our team.

  • Develop a thorough understanding of the current state of CCR analytic frameworks, end-to-end CCR metric generation processes and their connection with various upstream source systems.
  • Contribute to the research, development and implementation of new mathematical models for calculating various CCR measures. Considerable amount of creative, innovative & analytical thinking and problem solving is required.
  • Demonstrate exceptional communication skills (written and oral) by synthesizing key messages across distinct domains into a coherent action plan.
  • Leverage data analysis, querying and data exploration knowledge on CCR’s diverse number of data sources to perform statistical analysis, build machine learning models and deploy production-grade solutions for identifying insights and opportunities.
  • Become an expert in understanding CCR Innovative Analytics Team’s exiting libraries, leverage them to support delivery of new initiatives in collaboration with various CCR teams and lead KT sessions when required.
  • Partner with and support other teams as required; there are many teams, yet we are one team.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Graduate degree in STEM fields; double-major in Economics/Finance/Business and STEM. Strong grasp of fundamentals in statistics (hypothesis testing, regression, inference, and time series) and one of the key risk pillars (market, credit or liquidity).
  • Exceptional development expertise in Python programming writing production-grade code. Expertise with object-oriented and event-driven architecture (OOAD & SOLID principles) and Spark frameworks.
  • Strong data profiling, cleaning, engineering, mining and technical documentation skills; SQL/Data Stores: SQL, PostgreSQL, S3, HDFS and SparkQL.
  • Hands on experience with system configuration and DevOps tools (Jira, Git, GitHub and Confluence).
  • Self-starter with excellent communication skills, with proven ability to grow and mentor more junior technical professionals.

Nice-to-have

  • Experience developing interactive and sophisticated dashboards that communicate complex data insights to a diverse set business stakeholders.
  • Familiarity with building dashboards using Plotly and Dash in Python is an asset.
  • Experience with Airflow, graph databases, Jupyter Notebooks, other ML-related technologies.
  • Familiarity running distributed ML workloads in cluster orchestrated environments.
  • Experience with HTML, CSS and Web Development would be an asset.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
  • Opportunities to do challenging work.
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients.

Job Summary

As the Manager in Innovative Analytics Team, you will play a key role in contributing to continuous research, design and delivery of an advanced multi-disciplined risk analytic platform within the RBC Capital Markets Counterparty Credit Risk Management Team.

Your responsibilities will not be limited to, leveraging data analysis, querying and data exploration knowledge on CCR’s diverse number of data sources to perform statistical analysis, build machine learning models and deploy production-grade solutions for identifying insights and opportunities

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Group Risk Management

Job Type:

Contract (Fixed Term)

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2023-03-16

Application Deadline:

2023-03-31

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

item.title: Sr Manager, Portfolio Monitoring & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr Manager, Portfolio Monitoring & Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As Sr. Manager, Portfolio Monitoring Analytics, you support the Director in achieving the business objectives, strategic priorities and operational effectiveness goals of Business Credit and the Portfolio Monitoring team. You are responsible in providing MIS and analytics support to help ensure appropriate oversight and monitoring of the Business Credit portfolio and Field compliance activities and to support strategic initiatives and special projects.

What will you do?

• Use your strong analytical capabilities and ability to clearly formulate/articulate findings to stakeholders and senior management

• Apply understanding of Business Credit and Portfolio Monitoring processes to develop data requirements, gather and analyze reporting requirements, and determine the best data sources.

• Support strategic initiatives and specialized reporting through data sourcing, manipulation, analysis, visualizations, reporting and value-added insights, developing tool and BI solutions.

• Provide support to develop and continuously improve Portfolio Monitoring Reporting infrastructure for Business Credit and identify/recommend ways to simplify and automate processes.

• Enhance Business Credit client information capabilities and develop and analytic capabilities through SAS, SQL Server, Tableau and other technology

• Implement robust documentation of Business Credit Portfolio Monitoring Reporting and analytical procedures in a clear and concise manner for audit and regulatory purposes

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

• 5 to10 years of work experience in the financial services industry as well as a minimum of 3 years of experience with large relational databases

• Undergraduate or graduate degree in Business, Mathematics, or related fields

• Advanced SAS (including base SAS)

• Advanced SQL programming and SQL Server experience

• Strong proficiency in Tableau and advanced data visualization skills, including dashboard design, optimization and advanced calculated fields (Tableau Qualified Associate or above preferred); Strong understanding of Tableau Server, including setting up groups, folders, setting up permissions;

• Analytical mindset and excellent communication and presentations skills with proven ability to communicate effectively and build strong relationships through a collaborative and consultative approach

• Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision with good organizational awareness and strong execution excellence

Nice-to-have

• Knowledge of Small Business and Commercial Credits and Risks

• Experience with Teradata/Data Lake infrastructures

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

• Leverage this unique developmental opportunity to build out your analytical skills and deepen your knowledge about Commercial Credit and Business Markets.

• A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, flexible benefits, and competitive compensation

• Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

• Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

• Opportunities to do challenging work

Job Summary

Manages financial and administrative support functions and day-to-day activities to ensure financial objectives are fully achieved. Typically manages 2 or more specialized departments comprised of supervisors, managers, professionals, and/or large numbers of operational support employees.

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.

item.title: Senior Analyst, Environmental & Social Risk Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Analyst, Environmental & Social Risk Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

As part of the Environmental & Social Risk team within Group Risk Management, you will play a role in the management, monitoring, and mitigation of environmental and social (E&S) risks at RBC. You will support the design and implementation of key climate and E&S risk initiatives by providing research and data analytics and insights. A significant focus of this role will be the calculation of RBC’s financed emissions across different asset classes within carbon-intensive sectors and setting and tracking progress on net-zero targets.

The role will report to the Director, E&S Risk Analytics

What will you do?

  • Gather and analyze data required for climate and social risk measurement and work with the Director, E&S Risk Analytics to use this data to  inform actionable steps in the management and monitoring of environmental & social risk.
  • Identify opportunities to improve environmental & social risk data processes and take a leading role in implementing these changes;
  • Optimize data quality and results by seeking out public and private data sources and working with internal stakeholders to source RBC data to improve our climate risk measurement and management capabilities.
  • Collaborate with diverse internal stakeholders across business lines and functions to share E&S Risk data and insights, to inform risk management, business strategy, and ESG and climate disclosures.  
  • Work with the Director, E&S Risk Analytics to assist in the advancement of RBC’s capabilities in measuring financed emissions, setting net-zero targets, and delivering carbon accounting insights across the enterprise.
  • Contribute to and lead development and delivery of presentation and reports.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Degree in a quantitative discipline such as accounting, statistics, economics, econometrics, finance, mathematics, physics, engineering and/or a relevant professional qualification, with concentration in quantitative methods
  • An interest in Environmental and Social Risk in general and climate change in particular
  • An advanced understanding of programming and querying languages, including SQL and python
  • Experience developing presentations, visualizations and dashboards for senior executives and an interest in developing advanced analytical capabilities
  • Demonstrated ability in mathematical, statistical, financial or economic analyses on large, complex datasets and in translating data into business insights
  • A desire and ability to build new and innovative approaches to complex problems.
  • Commitment to quality and accuracy with a high level of attention to detail.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Nice-to-have

  • Knowledge of climate change science with experience in the development and use of climate change and economic scenarios, models, projections and data.
  • Knowledge or familiarity with the climate risk and/or target setting guidance issued by PCAF, NZBA, TCFD, ISSB, and/or OSFI (B-15)
  • Experience with or knowledge of carbon-intensive sectors, e.g. agriculture; aluminum; cement; coal; commercial and residential real estate; iron and steel; oil and gas; power generation; and transportation
  • Experience with or interest in agile or design thinking methodologies or frameworks.
  • Prior Product Management knowledge/experience or an interest in Product Management.
  • Knowledge and experience in quantitative model development, testing and validation.
  • Knowledge of wholesale and retail credit risk rating systems with experience in parameter estimation, portfolio management, or risk appetite.
  • Experience working with a diverse range of stakeholders.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
  • Opportunities to do challenging work.
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients.

Job Summary

This position will support the advancement of the bank’s Environmental and Social Risk data management, analysis and disclosure capabilities, and the integration of this data into our risk management framework.

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Full time

item.title: Associate Director, Environmental & Social Risk Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Environmental & Social Risk Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

As part of the Environmental & Social Risk team within Group Risk Management, you will play a role in the management, monitoring, and mitigation of environmental and social (E&S) risks at RBC. You will support and lead the design and implementation of key climate and E&S risk initiatives by providing research and data analytics and insights A significant focus of this role will be the calculation of RBC’s financed emissions across different asset classes within carbon-intensive sectors and setting and tracking progress on net-zero targets.

Note: This is a more senior position requiring more experience than a Senior Analyst, Environmental & Social Risk Analytics

What will you do?

  • Gather and analyze data required for climate and social risk measurement and work with the Director, E&S Risk Analytics to use this data to  inform actionable steps in the management and monitoring of environmental & social risk.
  • Identify opportunities to improve environmental & social risk data processes and take a leading role in implementing these changes;
  • Optimize data quality and results by seeking out public and private data sources and working with internal stakeholders to source RBC data to improve our climate risk measurement and management capabilities.
  • Collaborate with diverse internal stakeholders across business lines and functions to share E&S Risk data and insights, to inform risk management, business strategy, and ESG and climate disclosures.  
  • Work with the Director, E&S Risk Analytics to assist in the advancement of RBC’s capabilities in measuring financed emissions, setting net-zero targets, and delivering carbon accounting insights across the enterprise.
  • Contribute to and lead development and delivery of presentation and reports.
  • Lead workstreams and collaborations across multiple teams in order to accomplish the above
  • Contribute to the development and management of junior members of the E&S Risk Analytics teams

Must have

  • An interest in Environmental and Social Risk in general and climate change in particular
  • Experience in working in an analytics team, especially those tasked with solving difficult and/or vaguely-defined problems
  • An advanced understanding of programming and querying languages, including SQL and python
  • Experience developing presentations, visualizations and dashboards for senior executives and an interest in developing advanced analytical capabilities
  • Demonstrated ability in mathematical, statistical, financial or economic analyses on large, complex datasets and in translating data into business insights
  • A desire and proven ability to build new and innovative approaches to complex problems with minimal direction
  • Commitment to quality and accuracy with a high level of attention to detail.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Nice to have

  • Knowledge of climate change science with experience in the development and use of climate and economic scenarios, models, projections and data.
  • Knowledge or familiarity with the climate risk and/or target setting guidance issued by PCAF, NZBA, TCFD, ISSB, and/or OSFI (B-15)
  • Experience with or knowledge of carbon-intensive sectors, e.g. agriculture; aluminum; cement; coal; commercial and residential real estate; iron and steel; oil and gas; power generation; and transportation
  • Experience with or interest in agile or design thinking methodologies or frameworks.
  • Prior Product Management knowledge/experience or an interest in Product Management.
  • Knowledge and experience in quantitative model development, testing and validation.
  • Knowledge of wholesale and retail credit risk rating systems with experience in parameter estimation, portfolio management, or risk appetite.
  • Experience working with a diverse range of stakeholders.
  • People manager experience

What’s in it for you?

  • A Total Rewards program that includes flexible benefits, work/life balance and career development programs and investment and retirement savings plans
  • Competitive pay and high-earning potential
  • All the tools, training, and team support you need to grow your career
  • Flexible work/life balance options

Job Summary

This position will support the advancement of the bank’s Environmental and Social Risk data management, analysis and disclosure capabilities, and the integration of this data into our risk management framework.

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Group Risk Management

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2023-03-20

Application Deadline:

2023-04-08

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. item.title: Senior Manager, Physical Distribution Analytics & Planning
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Physical Distribution Analytics & Planning

Job Description

What will you do?

  • Responsible for the strategic planning of RBC’s physical network (includes branches, business banking centres, Private Banking Offices, Advice Centre Hubs , self-serve banking) as part of the transformation and alignment of RBC’s market presence to market opportunity
  • Complete in depth market and client analysis, to develop a 3-5 year market presence and coverage model plan for the region(s) and selected prioritized markets.  These recommendations will have a significant impact to RBC’s existing physical network and the future market opportunities across Canada
  • Develop business cases to support recommendations and  financial decisions
  • Provide market research for new developments, competitor intelligence and understanding forces of change (demographics, economic, regulatory) and their impact to future planning and considerations to transform the physical network
  • Analyze large data sets, representing the behaviors of clients relative to branches/market and other channel preferences to inform the strategy of RBC’s physical locations, formats and footprint.

Job Summary

What is the opportunity?
You will be responsible for the development of the 3-5 year market view for the physical distribution of RBC Retail and Commercial Business. This is accomplished by partnering with key business, functional and external partners to develop an overall market plan, including market presence and coverage of our physical distribution.

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

item.title: Associate Director, Risk and Investment Analytics Product Owner
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Risk and Investment Analytics Product Owner

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In this role, your primary responsibility will be around our Risk and Investment Analytics (R&IA) services which include Performance Reporting and Compliance monitoring services within Investor Services (“IS”). You will support the overall product strategy, direction and profitability for R&IA within RBC Investor Services, in alignment with the organization’s strategic objectives. In addition, you will support designing and developing product features to support client retention, target client acquisition, enhance client experience, help improve operational efficiency and deliver on commitments made to clients, including drive and oversee execution of approved product change/development, as well as support the Product Standards & the operating framework for R&IA.

What will you do?

  • Proactively involved in the assessment of available market intelligence and stakeholder feedback (clients and functions) on strategy and evolution of the Risk and Investment Analytics service, including target market, features, and product/service experience
  • Support development and maintenance of the R&IA product with a focus on delivering NIAT growth through enhancing and digitizing the product offering, generating client value and driving operational efficiency
  • Deliver a clear product roadmap in-collaboration with the Product team, Client Experience, Client Operations and Client Coverage
  • Work with the analyst team to conduct analysis on the development of product-related change and ensure change remains aligned to existing regulation and/or internal RBC policies
  • Support the design of the R&IA operating model(s), product standards and technical stack/architecture, with an objective to simplify and drive efficiency
  • Support client retention, win and/or upsell in collaboration with the business development team;
  • Work with the analyst team to gain an in-depth understanding of the P&L for the Risk and Investment Analytics services and embed financials in driving client, product, execution and functional change on product profitability
  • Develop an in-depth understanding of the upstream services such as Custody, Fund accounting and Private Capital Services how the data from these services impacts into Risk and Investment analytics
  • Responsible for collaborating with product team to improve upstream data that R&IA is reliant to improve efficiency and enhance the product offering
  • Gather sustainable, ongoing information in relation to client satisfaction with current RBC I&TS product suite and expectations for future product delivery
  • Responsible for ensuring appropriate governance, compliance with policies/frameworks and oversight of issues, risks, audit and compliance items
  • Present to RBC and IS senior management as requested by Product Heads and lead delivery of one-off initiatives as required by the Digital Client Experience and Product segment

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • BA or BSc in business, or other relevant degree
  • Over 5 years’ experience in the asset servicing industry, with a specific focus in  Performance reporting and Compliance monitoring services
  • Sound technical knowledge of the financial services and asset management industry
  • Experience in developing efficient strategies and business plans for Investment Performance and Compliance monitoring services
  • Strong technical knowledge and technical translation skills
  • Comfort in using sophisticated business information and analytic tools
  • Ability to understand both finance and business realities to challenge decisions Highly organized, self-motivated and entrepreneurial with drive to deliver products in-support of client experience and profitability objectives
  • Strong relationship management, communications and partnership development capabilities and skills
  • Ability to consume and distill significant amount of information and data and be able to present it in a simple manner to support decision making (so effectively strong communication skills north written and spoken)
  • Comfortable with ambiguity, a self-starter, someone who can also create their own day and results oriented
  • Excellent client service skills
  • Ability to manage small to medium sized teams 

Nice-to-have

  • MBA, MMA, CFA or post-graduate in business or finance
  • Professional qualifications from a recognized industry body
  • Fluency in French

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Excellent opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the RBC Investor 7 Treasury service business and gain knowledge and experience from a strong and diverse team
  • Opportunity to collaborate with other business segments within the bank
  • Excellent career development and progression opportunities
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
  • Competitive compensation

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Wealth Management

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

2023-02-23

2023-03-29

item.title: Sr. Manager, Reporting & Analytics - USCM Tech
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. Manager, Reporting & Analytics - USCM Tech

Job Description


RBC has made the strategic decision to become a Disruptor in the U.S. Cash Management space. By starting this journey, there is a significant opportunity to evolve and capitalize on a $100 Billion Dollar market segment in the U.S. In support of this vision, RBC aims to offer a frictionless, embedded payment and liquidity experience for its clients.  While RBC has an established Cash Management business in Canada, the U.S. based group will be built from scratch and anchored in a technical/digital play vs. a traditional play, enabling the Bank to compete with new entrants in this space.

What is the opportunity?

The US Cash Management (USCM) Technology team is undertaking a green field project to build a brand-new system to serve corporate clients. In this role, you will be responsible for the overall collection, accuracy, and reporting of USCM Tech initiatives. ​

Identifies and collects data sources, analyzes and extracts key data and information, evaluates and monitors data quality to meet the organization\'s information system needs and requirements. Applies advanced in-depth and/or broad knowledge, considered a top resource across the organization.


What will you do?

  • Reporting and Shared Knowledge:
    • Manage the USCM Tech reporting calendar
    • Prepare routine internal portfolio reporting for team leadership on initiative status (financials, risks, benefits)
    • Coordinate portfolio reporting to senior executives (incl. T&O, Group Heads, Board of Directors, etc.)
    • Administer and maintain tools environment for enterprise reporting on behalf of USCM Tech team
    • Ensure consistent reporting processes, approach and tools are in place (factoring in regional differences)
    • Update tools and sites to support shared knowledge and ensure adherence and use of standardized tools and process
  • Data Analytics
    • Subject Matter Expert on gathering development of reporting tools, quality control and measurement of data.
    • Responsible for bringing leading industry best practices into reporting and analytics design solutions for USCM Tech to the table for senior management to review
  • Identify opportunities for continuous improvements
  • Relationship and Communication
    • Provides executives and senior management with timely updates on project issues and manages communications including status reports
    • Effectively communicates and builds rapport with team members, stakeholders and interface groups across USCM using a variety of techniques and collaboration from initiation to close
    • Interacts with executives and senior management on the full range of matters related to USCM Tech reporting and analytics
  • Operational Risk, Compliance and Audits
    • Ensures operational risk activities are effectively managed and addressed.
    • Proactively monitors and ensures risk management deadlines are met and issues resolved on a timely basis.

Must have:

  • Experience with financial operations
  • 7+ years of project management experience with at least 3-5 years’ experience with large projects portfolios
  • Demonstrated data analytic & reporting experience
    • Experience using Tableau, SharePoint, Microsoft Office suite, JIRA and Confluenence
  • Strong client-focus and responsiveness to business needs
    • Experience in dashboard development
  • Well-developed communication and presentation skills including executive interaction

Nice to have:

  • PMP Certified or equivalent
  • Basic financial accounting knowledge
  • Exposure to financial services and/or financial products.

What\'s in It for You?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Positive work culture emphasizing diversity and inclusion, volunteerism, and community involvement
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including great benefits, annual incentive program and recognition
  • Leaders who support your development
  • A dynamic, collaborative, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work and grow your career
  • Work-life integration

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Technology and Operations

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2023-02-24-08:00

Application Deadline:

2023-02-27-08:00
